title: Considerations for handling updates in learned index structures
abstract: Machine learned models have recently been suggested as a rival for index structures such as B-trees and hash tables. An optimized learned index potentially has a significantly smaller memory footprint compared to its algorithmic counterparts, which alleviates the relatively high computational complexity of ML models. One unexplored aspect of learned index structures, however, is handling updates to the data and hence the model. In this paper we therefore discuss updates to the data and their implications for the model. Moreover, we suggest a method for eliminating the drift - the error of learned index models caused by the updates to the index- so that the learned model can maintain its performance under higher update rates.
tldr_ja: 機械学習モデルを用いたインデックス構造は、B木やハッシュテーブルに代わる可能性があるが、データの更新処理が未検討である。本論文では、データ更新がモデルに与える影響を考察し、インデックスの更新による誤差（ドリフト）を排除する手法を提案し、高い更新頻度でも性能を維持できることを目指す。
